---
title: "Analyzing Breaks in Yarn by Tension"
output: html_document
---

```{r}
library(broom)
library(pixiedust)
```

```{r}
data(warpbreaks)

fit <- lm(breaks ~ wool + tension, data = warpbreaks)

tidy(fit)

dust(fit) %>%
  sprinkle(pad = 6) %>%
  sprinkle(cols = 2:4, round = 3) %>%
  sprinkle(cols = 5, fn = quote(pvalString(value))) %>%
  sprinkle(rows = 1, border = "top") %>%
  sprinkle(rows = 4, border = "bottom") %>%
  sprinkle_colnames("Term", "Estimate", "Std. Err.", "T", "P-value") %>%
  sprinkle_print_method("html")
```

```{r}
fit_anova <- aov(breaks ~ wool + tension, data = warpbreaks)
tidy(fit_anova)
```

But I wonder, is there an interaction between wool and tension?

```{r}
fit_interaction <- aov(breaks ~ wool * tension, data = warpbreaks)
tidy(fit_interaction)

anova(fit_anova, fit_interaction)
```
